ingredients.name: Potassium Castorate
synonyms: potassium salt of castor oil fatty acids

ingredients.name: Potassium Cocoate
synonyms: potassium salt of coconut oil fatty acids

ingredients.name: Potassium Olivate
synonyms: potassium salt of olive oil fatty acids

ingredients.name: Sodium Castorate
synonyms: sodium salt of castor oil fatty acids

ingredients.name: Sodium Cocoate
synonyms: sodium salt of coconut oil fatty acids

ingredients.name: Sodium Olivate
synonyms: sodium salt of olive oil fatty acids

ingredients.name: Sodium Tallowate
synonyms: sodium salt of tallow fatty acids

ingredients.name: Witch Hazel
ingredients.description: Most witch hazel contains alcoholâ€”check with the manufacturer to confirm. Even alcohol-free versions can be drying, so use cautiously on high porosity hair.

ingredients.name: Flower Extract
ingredients.description: This is a flower extract, but we're not sure which one. These are generally considered harmless or beneficial.

ingredients.name: Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract
ingredients.description: A moisturizing ingredient that soothes the scalp and conditions hair

ingredients.name: Citric Acid
ingredients.description: Used to adjust pH levels and smooth hair cuticles

ingredients.name: Ethylhexylglycerin
ingredients.description: A humectant and preservative enhancer

ingredients.name: Glycereth-26
ingredients.description: A lightweight humectant that provides hydration without greasiness

ingredients.name: Glycerin
ingredients.description: A powerful humectant that attracts moisture to the hair

references.notes: It's very good at holding water (equilibrium hygroscopicity) and is virtually non-toxic

ingredients.name: Hydroxyethylcellulose
ingredients.description: A thickening agent that improves product texture

ingredients.name: Hydroxypropyltrimonium Honey
ingredients.description: A conditioning agent derived from honey that adds shine and softness

ingredients.name: Panthenol
ingredients.description: A moisturizing and strengthening agent that enhances hair elasticity

references.notes: Says it's a huge polymer with a very large water holding capacity

ingredients.name: Phenoxyethanol
ingredients.description: A preservative that prevents microbial growth in hair care products

ingredients.name: Silk Amino Acids
ingredients.description: A protein derivative that strengthens and smooths hair

ingredients.name: Sodium Phytate
ingredients.description: A chelating agent that stabilizes product formulations

ingredients.name: Sorbic Acid
ingredients.description: A preservative that inhibits the growth of mold and yeast

ingredients.name: Tocopheryl Acetate
ingredients.description: An antioxidant that protects hair and scalp from free radical damage

ingredients.name: Cellulose
ingredients.description: A natural polymer used as a thickener and stabilizer in hair care formulations

ingredients.name: PEG-100 Stearate
ingredients.description: An emulsifier that helps blend water and oil, improving the texture and stability of hair care products

ingredients.name: Fragrance
ingredients.description: A blend of aromatic compounds that provides a pleasant scent to hair care products. Some people are sensitive to fragrances and companies are not required to list which specific ingredients are used in their fragrance blends.

ingredients.name: Guar Hydroxypropyltrimonium Chloride
ingredients.description: A conditioning agent derived from guar gum, improving detangling and reducing static in hair

ingredients.name: Unknown Polyquat
ingredients.description: We're pretty sure this is a polyquat, but we're not sure which one.

ingredients.name: Magnesium Sulfate
ingredients.description: A mineral salt used as a texturizer and curl enhancer in hair care products. Some people find the texture unpleasant or drying. If you have issues with hard water, you might want to avoid it, because it's an extra source of the same minerals that can build up on your hair.

references.notes: Mentions that this ingredient roughs up the hair cuticle, which can be drying. It's also alkaline, which can swell the hair shaft, causing further damage.
Says it's a powerful curl enhancer but can be drying to some so advises using with a leave in conditioner.
Notes that Magnesium sulfate can be a component of hard water, which deposits on the hair. But did not find any evidence of damage.

ingredients.name: Lanolin
ingredients.description: This is an ingredient derived from wool with a complicated chemical structure and many uses. One issue with it is that it is comedogenic, meaning it can clog pores. This may be an issue for people with sensitive or dandruff prone scalps. It is also not vegan friendly.

references.notes: Moisture capacity 1.5 times greater than glycerin. Ability to hold water over time(dynamic hygroscopicity) is similar to glycerin
One of the best of the traditional humectants at holding water over time (dynamic hygroscopicity) though it holds less water than humectants like glycerin (equilibrium hygroscopicity)

ingredients.name: Sodium Thiosulfate
ingredients.description: Not a sulfate detergent, a harmless additive

ingredients.name: Copolymer
ingredients.description: This is an unknown copolymer, not in our db yet

ingredients.name: Diheptyl Succinate
ingredients.description: This is a natural alternative to silicones, but like silicones, it doesn't seem to be water soluble

references.notes: Mentions it's a natural alternative to silicone, which is oil soluble.

ingredients.name: Capryloyl Glycerin Sebacic Acid Copolymer
ingredients.description: This is a natural alternative to silicones, but like silicones, it doesn't seem to be water soluble

references.notes: Notes it is a natural ingredient used for providing hold and is easily washed out with water.

ingredients.name: VP VA copolymer
ingredients.description: Humidity resistant ingredient that provides hold in products like gels

ingredients.name: Propanediol
ingredients.description: A natural alternative to propylene glycol

references.notes: Hydrolyzed collagen with a molecular weight of 5000 to 15,000 Da is an excellent film-former that moisturizes the hair by coating the cuticle without deep absorption (film-former). Adds body, resiliency, shine, and manageability while reducing static.

Hydrolyzed collagen with a molecular weight of 2000 Da demonstrates substantivity to hair, meaning it adheres well to the hair's surface and penetrates its structure. Adheres best on damaged hair. Enhances tensile strength (resistance to breaking) and elasticity
Hydrolyzed collagen temporarily mends split ends, particularly in leave-in products, though higher concentrations yield diminishing benefits for damaged hair.

Hydrolyzed elastin with a molecular weight of 2000 to 5000 Da is a good film-former, similar to hydrolyzed collagen. It is much less hygroscopic (less water-absorbing) than collagen due to its lower polar and charged amino acid content.
Low-polarity protein hydrolysates like elastin and silk are preferable to collagen in applications where humidity resistance is desired.
High-molecular-weight hydrolyzed keratin (125,000 Da) provides long-term substantivity and conditioning effects when applied to reduced hair during permanent waving.

ingredients.name: Hydrolyzed Sweet Almond Protein
ingredients.description: Acts like almost a hybrid between a protein and a film-forming humectant because it contains both proteins and carbohydrates

references.notes: Hydrolyzed sweet almond protein contains both polypeptides and oligosaccharides.Conditioning effects result from polypeptides penetrating the hair and oligosaccharides coating it.
In leave-in products, hydrolyzed sweet almond protein enhances moisture retention and shine.
Strengthening of damaged hair and protection of hair fibers can be observed at use levels similar to those required for hydrolyzed collagen.

ingredients.name: Hydrolyzed Wheat Protein
ingredients.description: Acts like a hybrid between a film-forming humectant and a protein

references.notes: Hydrolyzed wheat protein and hydrolyzed wheat starch condition hair by both penetrating and coating, similar to hydrolyzed sweet almond protein.
Substantivity to normal hair increases with concentration, peaking rapidly at 2% actives and plateauing above 5% actives.

Studies on hair damaged with a 2% sodium hydroxide cream for 15 minutes showed that hydrolyzed wheat protein at 5% solids reduced brittleness at low relative humidity and limpness at high relative humidity.

ingredients.name: Hydrolyzed Wheat Starch
ingredients.description: Acts like a hybrid between a film-forming humectant and a protein

references.notes: Hydrolyzed wheat protein and hydrolyzed wheat starch condition hair by both penetrating and coating, similar to hydrolyzed sweet almond protein.

ingredients.name: Hydrolyzed Oat Protein
ingredients.description: Acts like a hybrid between a protein and a film-forming humectant because it contains both proteins and carbohydrates

references.notes: Hydrolyzed oat protein provides substantivity, shine, split-end repair, and a protective barrier to hair.

Collagen amino acids are very good at attracting and holding onto moisture (hygroscopic). This makes them excellent for moisturizing hair. Penetration makes hair pliable and soft, particularly at high relative humidity.
Wheat amino acid can function as humectants.

Has a low pH (3.1- 5) which is similar to the pH of the scalp/hair. Has antimicrobial properties. Capable of tightening the hair cuticle and has a mild cleansing ability. Advises that undiluted ACV may be hazardous to the eyes.

ingredients.name: Baking Soda
ingredients.description: An alkaline substance that can damage the hair cuticle and cause breakage

references.notes: It has a very high pH (9.5-10.5) which is very different from the pH of the scalp/hair. Can cause the cuticle to open up, allowing water to break up proteins like keratin and increasing negative charges in the hair. This lowers the elasticity of the hair and can cause breakage.
Capric / Caprylic triglycerides' ability to penetrate (soak into) hair hasn't been researched, but is likely given the oil's chemistry
